config.templates_helper_text: Click any of the templates above to customize how those views are presented to your customers. Warning: this functionality is for advanced users only.

spinner.loading_error: Failed to load cart include template
Failed to load web receipt template
Failed to load email receipt template

config.cart_type_custom_explainer: Build your own JSONP cart with included config
config.cart_type_fullpage_explainer: Send all customers to a full page cart while still including minicart functionality
config.checkout_type_helper_text: If you select Allow guests only, your store will not be able to use subscriptions.
config.custom_config_helper_text: If you have any custom values you'd like to make available to your twig template, you can add them here as a valid JSON string.
config.custom_fields_helper_text: If you have information you'd like to collect from the customer on the checkout page, you can add custom form fields here which will be added to the checkout form. We recommend you follow the same HTML container structure used on other checkout fields for consistency. You can use Twig syntax here.
config.custom_footer_helper_text: Any JS snippets or conversion scripts you need to add to the footer can be put here and will be inserted before the </body> tag. You can use Twig syntax here. For conversion scripts you only want to display once on the receipt page, use {% if first_receipt_display %} {# conversion script content here #} {% endif %}.
config.custom_header_helper_text: Any CSS or JS you need to add to the header can be put here and will be inserted before the </head> tag of your templates. Keep in mind all script file references must be through https or run through the Foxy caching system. Twig syntax is not available in the header.
config.delete_prompt: This resource will be permanently removed. Are you sure?
config.display_sdta: Display a Secure Data Transfer agreement to EU customers
config.display_sdta_explainer: If you have customers in the European Union, enable this feature so they can opt in to sending their data to our secure servers in the United States.
config.display_tos_link: Display a link to Terms & Conditions
config.display_tos_link_explainer: Include a checkbox to ask your customers to agree to your Terms of Service.
config.enable_postcode_lookup: Offer city and state suggestions based on postcode
config.foxycomplete_combobox_explainer: Expand to browse options, type to search
config.foxycomplete_disabled_explainer: Let customers pick an option from a list
config.foxycomplete_search_explainer: Display a «search as you type» field
config.ga_account_id_explainer: You can find the ID in the Admin section of your Analytics in Tracking info > Tracking code.
config.ga_include_on_site_explainer: Enable Google Analytics on any page where the loader.js file is included.
config.newsletter_subscribe: Allow users to sign up for your newsletter
config.newsletter_subscribe_explainer: This includes a checkbox on your checkout to allow customers to choose to sign up to your newsletter, available in the transaction reports, the API and webhooks.
config.sio_account_id_explainer: You can find the write key in your project set up guide or in the source’s settings.
config.supported_cards_disclaimer: Applies only to payment gateways where the customer enters their payment card information directly on the Foxy checkout. Exceptions: Adyen Embedded, Amazon Pay, Apple Pay, Klarna, Square and Stripe.
config.troubleshooting_debug: Log debug messages in the browser console
config.troubleshooting_debug_explainer: Enable this option to trigger console.log() calls for our JS, which can assist with troubleshooting your store.

delete.delete_prompt: Are you sure you'd like to remove this template set? You won't be able to bring it back.
